result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas G. Rice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

No possession/consumption of alcohol; no bars/taverns.

Submit to AODA/follow through.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Submit to an anger management assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

1 day credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas G. Rice

defendant.name: Rice, Douglas G.
defendant.address: 695 N. Main Street, Richland Center, WI 53581

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Douglas G. Rice in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead no contest to count 1 for dispo of 18 mo probation with conditions.  Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  withheld for 18 mo probation with conditions of no possession/consumption of alcohol, no bars/taverns, AODA/follow through, costs, and anger management assessment.  1 day credit in the event of revocation.  Count 2 DRI.
Status conference on June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Atty Peter Lawrence in court with defendant Douglas G. Rice. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def. waives formal reading. NG plea entered. Court states charge and informs def of the possible max penalties.  Atty Peter Lawrence asks for no contact to be lifted, and if not, if def can go to premises today for some belongings/documents. Atty Amy Forehand objects with the lifting of the no contact.  Court objects to lifting the no contact, no contact remains. Court states def may go to residence with law enforcement for belongings.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Def via video from Richland County jail
